Experience

Digital Surgeons

Fall 2014
New Haven, CT

Web Development Intern

Analyzed clients’ brands and built responsive, modern websites to improve marketing. Designed database sorting module for American Kennel Club. Constructed page for Nugo Nutrition site. Managed bugs on Human Rights Campaign site.

Yale Entrepreneurial Insitute - Tech Bootcamp

Summer 2014
Yale University

Intensively studied web development for 10 weeks, specifically Ruby on Rails, Javascript, HTML, and CSS. Developed and designed applications that create Youtube playlists, send timed e-mails to groups, and send nightly bedtime stories via text. Final application was project-centric social network to inspire creativity and interdisciplinary work in the Yale community.

New Haven++ Hackathon

Summer 2014
Yale University

Team Ending Homelessness

Competed in civic hackathon with New Haven and Yale developers; won first place for an application that managed data regarding moving homeless residents through the housing process.

Peabody Museum of Natural History

Winter - Spring 2014
New Haven, CT

Team Ant Story

Through introductory engineering course, designed and constructed interactive exhibit on display at museum on how ants leave and follow chemical traces. Modeled and printed 3D ant casing in Solidworks and prototyped line following vehicle.

Siren

Spring 2014
Seattle, WA

Operations Intern

Explored mobile app wireframes and beta testing process with startup founder and graphic designer. Networked with Seattle University professors, feminist-oriented authors, and local artists. Managed company expenses in Intuit Quickbooks.

MIT Women’s Technology Program

Summer 2012
Cambridge, MA

Mechanical Engineering Track

Measured and analyzed volumetric flow in gases, and presented lab results. Designed bio-inspired product to harvest water from fog, accompanied by poster presentation for MIT faculty and students. Completed a working Rube Goldberg machine as capstone project.

Museum of Science Boston

Fall 2011 - Summer 2013
Boston, MA

Discovery Center Volunteer

Taught and developed interest in science and technology for children eight years and younger through hands-on experiences in engineering (e.g. building gliders), physical sciences (qualifying minerals), and biology (assembling a skeleton).

Activities

Yale Medical School - Thoracostomy Project

Summer 2014 - present
Yale University

Engineering Team

Designed and prototyped device that increases accuracy and reduces trauma during chest tube insertion procedures. Received provisional patent in September 2014. Won Venture Capital Funding from Yale Entrepreneurial Institute.

Yale Undergraduate Aerospace Association

Fall 2013 - Fall 2014
Yale University

Rocket Competition Team

Team awarded Second Place in Payload Design at Intercollegiate Rocket Engineering Competition. Reached 7000 ft with payload designed to hold relativistic experiments at rocket speeds. Developed relativistic payload through research regarding atomic clocks and factors affecting possible experiments. Constructed rocket through sawing fiberglass and molding carbon fiber. Organized meetings with Yale Physics, Astronomy, and Electrical Engineering professors regarding relativity. Modeled and constructed rocket Artemis reaching 5000 ft that released payload at maximum height.

Yale Solar Decathlon

Spring 2014 - present
Yale University

Heating & Cooling Team

Invented heating/cooling system that utilizes solar energy through a thermosiphon and flat plate collectors. Developed passive heating system through hot water under floor boards. Integrated system with plumbing for simple disposal. Researched individual component schematics for system.

Yale Student Technology Collaborative

Winter 2014 - present
Yale University

Student Tech

Resolved software and browser issues for Windows and OS X. Extracted and replaced hardware components of student laptops. Advised students face-to-face in troubleshooting office. Managed student incidents through daily communication.
